documentation:
The varibility model is responsible for managing variation in MASD.

One of the core principles of MASD is to enable the development of
"families" of software products; that is, sets of products which share
similar "traits". Those traits are encoded as "configuration" so that
we can talk about them at a higher level of abstraction. This approach
is often referred to in the literature as Software Product Line
Engineering (SPLE). MASD takes a very simplistic view of SPLE,
allowing a very restricted form of variation across a set of
well-defined features. The present model provides the basic
infrastructure required to define features, as well as to read those
features from dynamic data structures.

Note that the present model only concerns itself with the low-level
implementation of variability. You can think of it as a stack, with
this model sitting at the bottom. Above it lie the logical
representation of variability, which enables the code generator to
generate code that makes use of the infrastructure provided by this
model. But the present model is designed to be understood in complete
isolation from the layers above (and in fact, precedes the generalised
approach).

The variability space is indirectly connected to the physical dimension.
The main reason why is because we need to instantiate features across
the geometry of physical space (e.g. "for every facet...", "for every
archetype...", etc). However, we have tried to avoid coupling these two
models together because we do not think that conceptually this coupling
makes sense. That is, it just happens that we instantiate features across
the geometry of physical space, but this is not a concern o veriability -
only of its user. This decoupling was achieved by creating the concept
of template instantiation domains, which are just sets. These are mapped
elsewhere from the geometry of physical space.

elements.name: entities
elements.documentation:
Contains all of the types describing variability
with Masd.

elements.name: entities::element
elements.documentation: Represents an element modeling some aspect of variability.

elements.name: entities::feature
elements.documentation: Unit of configuration within Dogen. Defines the domain of values.

attributes.name: is_partially_matchable
attributes.documentation: Feature name can be matched partially.

elements.name: entities::name
elements.documentation: Name of the element in the variability metamodel.

attributes.name: simple
attributes.documentation: Non-qualified name of the element.

attributes.name: qualified
attributes.documentation: Qualified name of the element, using dots to separate the hierarchy.

elements.name: entities::binding_point
elements.documentation: Determines how a feature can be bound to a modeling element.

attributes.name: any
attributes.documentation: Feature can be configured anywhere.

attributes.name: global
attributes.documentation: Feature can only be configured in the root module.

attributes.name: element
attributes.documentation: Feature can be configured in any modeling element.

attributes.name: property
attributes.documentation: Feature can only be configured in a property of a modeling element.

attributes.name: operation
attributes.documentation: Feature can only be configured in an operation of a modeling element.

elements.name: entities::feature_model
elements.documentation: Container of all available features, organised for querying.

attributes.name: by_name
attributes.documentation: Features by qualified name.

attributes.name: partially_matchable
attributes.documentation: Features that can be partially matcheable, by qualified name.

elements.name: entities::feature_template
elements.documentation: Defines a template that can be used to instantiate features.

attributes.name: default_value_overrides
attributes.documentation: Overrides for the default value, if any.

elements.name: entities::value_type
elements.documentation: What values can a feature have.

attributes.name: text
attributes.documentation: Represents a text value.

attributes.name: text_collection
attributes.documentation: Represents a collection of text values.

attributes.name: number
attributes.documentation: Represents a numeric integral value.

attributes.name: boolean
attributes.documentation: Represents a boolean value.

attributes.name: key_value_pair
attributes.documentation: Represents a pair of key and value.

attributes.name: comma_separated
attributes.documentation: Represents a CSV input that is split into a collection of text values.

elements.name: entities::profile_template
elements.documentation: Holds a set of templates for configuration points.

elements.name: entities::value
elements.documentation:
Base class of all value types.

Represents a value for a configuration point, a default value for a feature, etc.

elements.name: entities::number
elements.documentation: Represents a numeric integral value.

elements.name: entities::text
elements.documentation: Represents a text value.

elements.name: entities::text_collection
elements.documentation: Represents a collection of text values.

elements.name: entities::boolean
elements.documentation: Represents a boolean value.

elements.name: entities::key_value_pair
elements.documentation: Represents a pair of key and value.

attributes.name: content
attributes.documentation:
The data structure was chosen to guarantee that the order is maintained from 
source.

attributes.name: profile_bindings
attributes.documentation: Bindings to profiles.

attributes.name: configuration_bindings
attributes.documentation:
Relationships between this bound configuration and other bound configurations.

These relationships are inferred from the relationships of the underlying model
elements.

attributes.name: source_binding_point
attributes.documentation: Where was this configuration sourced from with regards to binding.

attributes.name: from_target
attributes.documentation: If true, this configuration was sourced from an element in the target model.

elements.name: entities::configuration_point
elements.documentation: Maps a feature name to an instance value

attributes.name: description
attributes.documentation: Human readable description of the feature, used for documentation.

attributes.name: default_value
attributes.documentation: Default value for element, if any.

attributes.name: value_type
attributes.documentation: Type of the value for the feature that will result of the template instantiation.

attributes.name: binding_point
attributes.documentation: How the feature binds against other model elements.

elements.name: transforms::context
elements.documentation: Context for transformations.

attributes.name: template_instantiation_domains
attributes.documentation:
Provides all of the domains to be used for template instantiation.

Example of a domain is "masd.facet" which contains the list of all available facets.
Templates (facet and profile) are then instantiated over this range, depending on 
user choices.

elements.name: transforms::transformation_error
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst applying a transformation.

elements.name: helpers::instantiation_exception
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst instantiating templates.

attributes.name: instantiation_domain_name
attributes.documentation:
Name of the domain to use for template instantiation.

@pre The instantiation domain name must exist.

attributes.name: value
attributes.documentation: Value that has been assigned to this element.

attributes.name: configuration_points
attributes.documentation: All configuration points associated with this element.

attributes.name: merged
attributes.documentation: If true, the profile has been merged with all of its parents.

attributes.name: base_layer_profile
attributes.documentation: Which base layer does this profile rely on, if any.

elements.name: entities::binding_action
elements.documentation: What action to take when binding.

attributes.name: ignore
attributes.documentation: Ignores the implict relationship.

attributes.name: copy
attributes.documentation: Copy across the value of the feature from the related element

elements.name: entities::potential_binding
elements.documentation: Contains information about a potential binding.

attributes.name: name
attributes.documentation:
The name to bind to. This can represent a profile or configuration name, or an
alias.

attributes.name: realized
attributes.documentation: If true, the potential binding was realised into an actual binding.

elements.name: entities::feature_template_repository
elements.documentation: Stores a set of feature templates.

elements.name: helpers::enum_mapping_exception
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst mapping enums to or from strings.

elements.name: features
elements.documentation: Features used by the variability model.

elements.name: features::profile
elements.documentation: Features related to profile processing.

attributes.name: profile
attributes.documentation: Profile associated with this configuration.

elements.name: helpers::adaption_exception
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst adapting a model.

elements.name: entities::feature_repository
elements.documentation: Stores a set of features.

elements.name: entities::default_value_override
elements.documentation: Stores an override for a default value.

elements.name: helpers::merging_exception
elements.documentation: An error occurred whilst merging.

elements.name: entities::comma_separated
elements.documentation: Represents a CSV input that is split into a collection of text values.
